Issue #9146: Labels: No Labels
Comments: [{'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/rocketmq/issues/comments/2617835409', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/9146#issuecomment-2617835409', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/rocketmq/issues/9146', 'id': 2617835409, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOBHrsl86cCP-R', 'user': {'login': 'zqyhimself', 'id': 123203214, 'node_id': 'U_kgDOB1fujg', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/123203214?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/zqyhimself', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/zqyhimself/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-01-28T04:45:21Z', 'updated_at': '2025-01-28T04:45:21Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': 'I have analyzed the root cause of the issue and its solutions.\n\nRoot Cause of the Issue\n\nThe issue arises because the default value of pullBatchSize in the Go Pull Consumer is set to 0. In RocketMQ‚Äôs implementation, maxMsgNums (which corresponds to pullBatchSize) cannot be 0, as this prevents correct access to the logical queue.\n\nSpecifically:\n\t1.\tIn your code, you did not set consumer.WithPullBatchSize(), which caused the default value of 0 to be used.\n\t2.\tWhen this value is sent to the server, stricter parameter checks in the RocksDB storage mode result in message pull failures.\n\t3.\tIn the default ConsumeQueue storage mode, this issue might not be apparent due to fault tolerance mechanisms, but in RocksDB mode, it directly fails.\n\nSolutions\n\nShort-term Solution:\nExplicitly set pullBatchSize when creating the Pull Consumer:\n\npullConsumer, err = rocketmq.NewPullConsumer(\n    consumer.WithGroupName(consumerGroupName),\n    consumer.WithNameServer(nameSrv),\n    consumer.WithMaxReconsumeTimes(2),\n    consumer.WithPullBatchSize(32), // Add this line and set a reasonable value (1-1024)\n)\n\nLong-term Solutions:\n\t1.\tSet a reasonable default value (e.g., 32) for pullBatchSize in the Go client.\n\t2.\tAdd parameter validation to ensure that pullBatchSize falls within a valid range (1-1024).\n\t3.\tImprove the documentation to clearly explain the requirements and limitations of this parameter.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/rocketmq/issues/comments/2617835409/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

IMO, only the first startup will make a request to the serverÔºåwill not bring more network traffic.\r\n\r\nNormally, if rebalance=false is enabled, all topics will be rebalanced on the server as they are added to the topicBrokerRebalance collection, but when a network issue occurs, Some topics will be added topicClientRebalance, and this part of the client will be rebalanced in PULL.\r\n\r\nSince it should be carried out on the server side, there is no need for this network communication, which not only brings overhead but also causes cache errors. initializing, these four files (including duplicate files) will be loaded into mappedFiles, and a self-check error ERROR log will be printed in the checkSelf function.\r\n![c8fa8f77de6a43d703faa805dae309ff](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32f5a77a-293b-438c-aa7c-fb239da7f6d2)\r\n\r\nWhat's more serious is that when using offset to find MappedFile, the first MappedFile will be returned. If this file is one of the empty files, it means that there is no message here, or it will cause a more serious system exception.\r\n![2e4f331f8de32edf10d5b38dc11f335d](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/49267ef4-66ff-4286-a295-8b4457958460)\r\n\r\nI haven't done more testing, so I'm not sure if this bug only affects consumption, but I think this issue has a big impact on system stability.\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/rocketmq/issues/comments/2463797363/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'2024-10-24T02:01:01Z', 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': '> The performance loss is not related to prefetching. The schedule message deliver speed is 160/s because every time the iterator only returns 16 messages, and the deliver thread will sleep 100ms after iterate finish. See org.apache.rocketmq.broker.schedule.ScheduleMessageService.DeliverDelayedMessageTimerTask#executeOnTimeUp\r\n\r\n1. The original implementation uses one-shot(at most 16 results) multi-get to simulate iterator; The outcome iterator fails to return all results, thus, does not fit well for the mentioned use case;\r\n2. You change is to use lazy single get to iterate; and use potential pre-fetch to accelerate;\r\n3. A third option is to directly wrap RocksIterator with prefix;\r\n\r\nIt would be best to make further comparisons in terms of performance(why multi-get at present), code maintenance, ...\r\nAfter all pros and cons are clarified, we may finalize this pull request.\r\n\r\nAnother issue is option 2, aka, this pull request, changes original behavior. Another solustion is not to sleep 100ms after each iteration.\r\nAs for the behavior, the default ConsumeQueue only iters one file, the RocksDBConsumeQueue only iters at most 16 items. so I think the
